Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Price of precious metals is inversely related to performance of stock market. Since the ongoing(?) bull market from 2009, prices of precious metals(gold) havent been doing so well. If the market turns bearish, prices of gold, etc will probably increase too. On the other hand, you can consider buying precious metals to diversify your portfolio (there are Gold ETFs too).2 comments1

Question Poster28 Oct 2018Is GLD ETF, certificates and stuff better or physical Gold?Lok Yang Teng28 Oct 2018When buying physical gold, there are different types, bullion or commemorative coins (excluding gold plated). Commemorative coins usually appreciate in value (depending on supply and demand) + value of the gold itself. Downside is that you have to find somewhere safe to keep it and will incur deposit fees. Bullion are usually bought from banks and kept there, while the bank will issue a certificate (an IOU).
